page.title: 10TEN TORS TRAINING
page.content: Local teams for the Ten Tors are lucky in being able to train on the same ground as the final event. Often weather during training is worse than those during the weekend in May when Ten Tors is held. 1985 was typical in this respect, with the first training session for the local Okehampton College teams being in 'Artic' conditions, in February snow,ice and sleet combine with very strong, cold northerly winds. The whole point of the exercise was summed up by a team members comment after this first day training, "You find out a lot about yourself up there". You also find out a lot about your friends and how to get along in a team. Over the weeks of training you also get to know the moor in all its different moods; rain, wind and shine. A pictures shows Okehampton College girls 35mile team finishing.
